revision.text:
{{wiktionary|Hollywood}}
'''[[Hollywood]]''' is a district of Los Angeles, California, which lent its name to the [[Cinema of the United States|American motion-picture industry]].
'''Hollywood''' may also refer to:
{{TOC Right}}
== Places == * [[Hollywood, County Wicklow]], Ireland * [[Hollywood, Worcestershire]], England * ''Hollywood of Europe'', a notion used for [[Babelsberg Studio]]s for historical reasons * [[Hollywood North]], a colloquialism used to describe Vancouver and other places in Canada * [[Hollywood Park (disambiguation)]] * [[Hollywood Road]], a road in Hong Kong
=== United States === * [[Hollywood District (disambiguation)]] * [[Hollywood, Alabama]], a town in Jackson County * [[Hollywood, Homewood, Alabama]], a historic district and former town * [[Hollywood, Florida]], a coastal city in Broward County * [[Hollywood (Tri-Rail station)]], a historic train station * [[Hollywood, Georgia]], an unincorporated community in Habersham County, Georgia * [[Hollywood (Metra)]], one of three stations on Metra's BNSF Railway Line in Brookfield, Illinois * [[Hollywood, Maryland]] * [[Hollywood, Minnesota]] * [[Hollywood Township, Carver County, Minnesota]] * [[Hollywood, Mississippi]] * [[Hollywood (Benoit, Mississippi)]], an historic house * [[Hollywood, Missouri]] * [[Hollywood, New Mexico]], a neighborhood of Ruidoso, Lincoln County, New Mexico * [[Hollywood, Luzerne County, Pennsylvania]] * [[Hollywood, Montgomery County, Pennsylvania]] * [[Hollywood, South Carolina]] * [[Hollywood, Memphis]], Tennessee * [[Hollywood, Appomattox County, Virginia]] * [[Hollywood, Pittsylvania County, Virginia]] * [[Hollywood Cemetery (Richmond, Virginia)]] * [[Hollywood, Monroe County, West Virginia]] * [[Hollywood, Raleigh County, West Virginia]]
== People == === Surnames === * [[Edwin L. Hollywood]] (1892–1958), American film director * [[Gary Hollywood]], Scottish Actor * [[Jesse James Hollywood]] (born 1980), convicted murderer * [[Matt Hollywood]], American indie rock musician * [[Paul Hollywood]] (born 1966), English chef from Merseyside, UK
=== First or adopted names === * [[Jeanne Basone]], actress who portrayed "Hollywood" in ''Gorgeous Ladies of Wrestling'' * [[The Hollywood Blonds]], a professional wrestling tag-team * [[Hollywood Fats]] (1954–1986), American blues guitarist * [[Chris Gethard]], "#HollywoodGethard", American comedian * [[Thomas "Hollywood" Henderson]], American football player * [[Hulk Hogan]] or "Hollywood Hulk Hogan" (b. 1953), American professional wrestler and actor * [[Hardcore Holly|Hollywood Bob Holly]], a name used briefly by professional wrestler Bob Holly * [[Tom Marechek]] or "Hollywood", Canadian lacrosse player * [[Scott Scurlock]] or "Hollywood" (1955–1996), bank robber
== Science and technology == * [[Hollywood (database)]], a RNA splicing database * [[Hollywood (graphics chip)]] * [[Hollywood (programming language)]], a multimedia-oriented programming language * ''[[Auranticarpa rhombifolia]]'' or Hollywood, an Australian tree * Holly wood, wood from a [[holly]] plant
== Arts and culture ==
=== Fictional characters and toys === * Holli Would, a character in the film ''[[Cool World]]'' * Hollywood, a character in the series ''[[2 Stupid Dogs]]'' * Hollywood, a mail-offer Flutter Pony from the original ''[[My Little Pony]]'' toyline * Hollywood Montrose, a character in the film ''[[Mannequin (1987 film)|Mannequin]]'' * [[Hollywoods]], a toy doll series
=== Film and television === * [[Hollywood (1923 film)|''Hollywood'']] (1923), silent comedy film by James Cruze * [[Hollywood (British TV series)|''Hollywood'']] (1980), British documentary television series about the silent era * [[Hollywood (2002 film)|''Hollywood'']] (2002), Kannada film starring Upendra as a robot * [[Hollywood (Law & Order: LA)|"Hollywood"]] (2010), episode of ''Law & Order: Los Angeles'' * [[Hollywood (miniseries)|''Hollywood'']] (2020), American television miniseries from Netflix
=== Games === * [[Hollywood (video game)|''Hollywood'' (video game)]], a 1995 creative writing computer game
=== Literature === * [[Hollywood (Bukowski novel)|''Hollywood'' (Bukowski novel)]], a 1989 novel by Charles Bukowski * [[Hollywood (Vidal novel)|''Hollywood'' (Vidal novel)]], a novel by Gore Vidal
=== Music === * Hollywood, a 1990s female UK/Swedish electro pop duo, part of the [[Romo]] movement * [[Hollywood Records]], an American record label part of the Disney Music Group * [[Hollywood Undead]], an American rap rock band
==== Albums ==== * [[Hollywood (Circle album)|''Hollywood'' (Circle album)]] (2008) * [[Hollywood (Flavor Flav album)|''Hollywood'' (Flavor Flav album)]] (2006) * [[Hollywood (Little Birdy album)|''Hollywood'' (Little Birdy album)]] (2006) * [[Hollywood (Jamie Foxx album)|''Hollywood'' (Jamie Foxx album)]] (2015) * [[Hollywood (Johnny Hallyday album)|''Hollywood'' (Johnny Hallyday album)]] (1979) * [[Hollywood (The Puppini Sisters album)|''Hollywood'' (The Puppini Sisters album)]] (2011) * [[Hollywood (Tercer Cielo album)|''Hollywood'' (Tercer Cielo album)]] (2008) * [[Hollywood (EP)|''Hollywood'' (EP)]], an EP by Angus & Julia Stone * ''Hollywood'', album by [[Nana Mouskouri]] * ''Hollywood'', a 1977 album by [[Véronique Sanson discography#Albums|Véronique Sanson]]
==== Songs ==== * [[Hollywood (The Cranberries song)|"Hollywood" (The Cranberries song)]] * [[Hollywood (Gorillaz song)|"Hollywood" (Gorillaz song)]] * [[Hollywood (Jay Z song)|"Hollywood" (Jay Z song)]] * [[Hollywood (Kasey Chambers song)|"Hollywood" (Kasey Chambers song)]] * [[Hollywood (Madonna song)|"Hollywood" (Madonna song)]] * [[Hollywood (Marina and the Diamonds song)|"Hollywood" (Marina and the Diamonds song)]] * [[Hollywood (Michael Bublé song)|"Hollywood" (Michael Bublé song)]] * "[[Hollywood (Africa)]]", a 1985 song by Red Hot Chili Peppers * "[[Hollywood (Down on Your Luck)]]", a 1981 song by Thin Lizzy * "[[Hollywood/I Am the Resurrection]]", a double A-side single by Codeine Velvet Club (2009) * "Hollywood", by After Midnight Project from ''[[Let's Build Something to Break]]'' (2009) * "Hollywood", by Alabama from ''[[Feels So Right]]'' (1981) * "Hollywood", by America from ''[[Holiday (America album)|Holiday]]'' (1974) * "Hollywood", by Boz Scaggs from ''[[Down Two Then Left]]'' (1977) * "Hollywood", by Collective Soul from ''[[Afterwords (Collective Soul album)|Afterwords]]'' (2007) * "Hollywood", by Dog's Eye View from ''[[Daisy (Dog's Eye View album)|Daisy]]'' (1997) * "Hollywood", by Jonas Brothers from the [[Jonas Brothers (album)|self-titled album]] (2006) * "Hollywood", by Labelle from ''[[Pressure Cookin']]'' (1973) * "Hollywood", by Lewis Capaldi from ''[[Divinely Uninspired to a Hellish Extent]]'' (2019) * "Hollywood", by Nickelback from ''[[Silver Side Up]]'' (2001) * "Hollywood", by Pink Floyd, an [[List of unreleased songs recorded by Pink Floyd#"Hollywood"|unreleased song]] * "Hollywood", by P.O.D. from ''[[The Fundamental Elements of Southtown]]'' (1999) * "Hollywood", by Rufus and Chaka Khan from ''[[Ask Rufus]]'' (1977) * "Hollywood", by The Runaways from ''[[Queens of Noise]]'' (1977) * "Hollywood", by Shooting Star from ''[[Hang On for Your Life]]'' (1981) * "Hollywood", by Silverchair on "[[Without You (Silverchair song)|Without You]]" (2002) * "Hollywood", by Smile.dk from ''[[Future Girls]]'' (2000) * "Hollywood", by [[Streetheart (band)|Streetheart]] * "Hollywood", by Suzi Quatro from ''[[Suzi ... and Other Four Letter Words]]'' (1979) * "Hollywood", by The Veronicas on "[[Untouched (song)|Untouched]]" (2007) * "Hollywood", by [[Waterloo & Robinson]] (1974) * “Hollywood” and “Hollywood’s Dead”, by [[Lana Del Rey]], both are unreleased songs. * "Hollywood", by ''[[Adler's Appetite (EP)#Track listing|Adler's Appetite]]'' (2005)
==Brands== * [[Hollywood (cigarette)]], a Brazilian brand of cigarettes * [[Hollywood.com]], a U.S. entertainment news website * [[Hollywood Brands]], a defunct American confectionery company * [[Hollywood Chewing Gum]], a French chewing gum brand * [[Hollywood Video]], a DVD and video game rental shop chain
